content: norwegian protest hat original idea credit the idea for this hat came from the melt the ice hat by yarncultmn i was unaware of the history of this hat before then unfortunately i don t knit and i was looking for a more historically accurate-looking hat to make and thus this crochet pattern was born history of the hat during world war ii the norwegian nisselue became a potent visual symbol of defiance against the nazi occupation of norway when germany occupied norway in 1940 the norwegian people looked for subtle ways to signal their loyalty to the exiled king haakon vii and their resistance to the puppet regime led by vidkun quisling by 1942 the act of wearing a red cap had become such a widespread and effective silent protest that the german authorities and the nasjonal samling the norwegian nazi party officially banned them police were ordered to confiscate the hats often pulling them off people s heads in the street this led to absurd scenes where children were targeted by authorities for their headwear which only served to further galvanize the resistance and make the occupiers look ridiculous in the eyes of the public it remains a historical reminder of how ordinary objects can be transformed into powerful tools for political expression and national solidarity during times of crisis where to donate this pattern is free if you are financially able to do so please donate whatever amount you feel appropriate to any of the following nonprofit organizations ● the national immigrant justice center ● immigrant defense project ● american civil liberties union aclu ● the immigrant legal resource center ilrc ● national immigration law center nilc notes the pattern uses single_crochet for a stiffer hat without holes that will be better for cooler weather for a floppier slightly more breathable hat try moss stitch single_crochet in every other stitch/skip a stitch using half_double_crochet will have a similar effect but the hat will be much longer while there is no video for this pattern the final page contains visuals and links to videos for each step/stitch you may or may not know items needed ● worsted yarn 4/medium in red i used big twist value yarn in deep red ● 5 0mm us/h crochet hook ● tapestry needle ● scissors ● stitch markers optional abbreviations blo = back loop only chain = chain repeat = repeat single_crochet = single_crochet sts = stitches pattern hat brim chain 26 - leave a long tail for sewing later ~9-10 row 1 single_crochet in second chain from hook and each across to the end turn 25 sts row 2 chain 1
